content: my husband has family in norway and i have become obsessed with all the beautiful norwegian knitting this pattern is for a type of traditional mitten called selbuvotter the selburose the 8-pointed star is used in a lot of winter clothing especially in sweaters lusekofte and mittens votter traditionally these are knit in red and white or black and white but any two contrasting colors would work well i wasn t able to find a basic pattern written in english so i charted one based on pictures and wrote a simple pattern for it this is not my own pattern it was inspired by all the beautiful selbuvotter that i have admired for years there are so many variations on the selburose i encourage you to try others after completing this one gauge this pattern is written for an average sized woman s hand try going up a needle size or two for larger hands yarn 2 skeins dk weight 1 of each color needles us size 2/2 75mm us size 3/3 25mm this pattern is written for dpn s but can easily be converted to magic loop just split the stitches in half for the front and back stitches there are two charts included in this pattern one is a classic chart with a front and back mitten that will need to be reversed for the left hand so the thumb is on the correct side the other chart has both the right and left sides so you just knit the side that you need for each mitten use the chart that makes the most sense to you
